name: International Fur Trade Federation
goal:
In 1949, members of the fur trade formed the International Fur Trade Federation (IFTF), which brings together national associations from all parts of the world. With 48 member organisations in 39 countries, IFTF includes practically every important fur producing and consuming country.

It draws together and represents people from across the full spectrum of the trade: farmers; trappers; auction houses; merchants; brokers; dressers and dyers; manufacturers; wholesalers; marketing organisations and retailers.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Internal Market, Regional Policy, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives: Farming, hunting, trapping, environment management, dying and dressing of animal products, trade, product labelling, traceability, certification, animal science and transportation of goods.
